title: Four Arrested In South Korea After 120,000 Home Cameras Hacked For ‘Sexploitation’ Videos | 10 News+
description: Authorities in South Korea have arrested four people for allegedly hacking into more than 120,000 cameras in homes and businesses. Police say they targeted karaoke rooms, a Pilates studio, and even a gynaecology clinic, using the footage to make sexually exploitative material for an overseas website. One of the suspects is accused of hacking 63,000 cameras and producing 545 sexually exploitative videos, which he then sold for $36,000 AUD. title: WHO Makes Historic Call On Weight-Loss Drugs Including Ozempic And Wegovy | 10 News+
description: The World Health Organisation has made a landmark decision on weight loss drugs, giving the green light for medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy to be used as long-term treatments for obesity across the world. They've also called for greater access to the drugs, which are currently too expensive for many in developing countries. title: Worries Australian Super Could Be Impacted By Forecast AI Stock Plummet | 10 News+
description: There are growing concerns that Australian superfunds could be compromised if a forecast market meltdown occurs. Aussie superannuation funds are tied to AI stocks through global investment portfolios and if the AI bubble bursts, Australian retirement savings could take a big hit too. title: ‘Cool Runnings’ Becomes A Reality As Jamaican Bobsled Team Wins First Gold Medal | 10 News+

title: Nuns Who Escaped From Nursing Home Refuse To Stop Posting On Instagram | 10 News
description: When you think of influencers, nuns in their eighties probably don't spring to mind.  But you might remember this trio of Austrian sisters, who went viral after escaping their retirement home to move back to their beloved convent.  Now they're facing a new battle - and they're refusing to be silenced. title: Putin Claims Russia Is Ready To Go To War with Europe | 10 News
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has issued a warning to the rest of Europe, as European powers hinder peace talks between Russia, Ukraine and the United States.  Putin said that while Russia is "not planning to fight Europe", it is ready if European nations wage war against his country.  He also accused major European powers of putting forward proposals in talks to end the war with Ukraine that were "absolutely unacceptable", forcing Russia to deny peace. title: How A Radioactive Fungus Growing At Chernobyl Could Help Take Us To Mars | 10 News
description: The site of the world’s worst nuclear disaster has turned into the home of a rare fungus, which scientists say could become a tool for space travel.  An exclusion zone was set up surrounding Chernobyl after the 1986 explosion, leaving behind a highly radioactive wasteland that is deadly to almost all life.  10’s Late News explains. title: Trump And Hegseth Defend Deadly Venezuelan Boat Strikes, Threaten Land Strikes | 10 News
description: President Donald Trump and Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth have insisted they had no knowledge of a second strike on survivors aboard a suspected Venezuelan drug boat, as pressure mounts over whether the attack was lawful.  Both men shifted responsibility to Special Operations commander Admiral Mitch Bradley, despite earlier claims the operation was closely monitored.  Trump defended the broader anti-drug campaign but distanced himself from the follow-up strike while threatening to expand the mission with ground operations inside Venezuela.  Bipartisan lawmakers are demanding full footage of the September attack, warning the administration may be withholding key details. title: WHO Approves Ozempic For Obesity Treatment | 10 News+
description: The World Health Organisation has approved Ozempic and other similar medications for long-term obesity treatment worldwide.  However, the TGA, Australia's medical watchdog, warns that the use of the injectables could lead to possible suicidal thoughts.

title: Truck Driver Rescued From Dangling Vehicle Off West Virginia Highway | 10 News
description: A tractor-trailer driver has been rescued after his cab dangled over a bridge for several hours following a crash amid a major winter storm in West Virginia.  The truck carrying bricks reportedly lost control in snowy conditions and crashed on northbound US 35, spilling diesel fuel onto the road.  Rescue crews used a ladder truck to lift the driver out of the cab, and it’s understood he was uninjured.
